intro: Dendrospartum purgans, commonly known as the yellow wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves contain oxalic acid, which can be toxic if ingested in large quantities. Dendrospartum purgans is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
